boone.training

Class BackpropTrainer

  • java.lang.Object
    • boone.Trainer
      • boone.training.BackpropTrainer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Storable, java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    RpropTrainer

    public class BackpropTrainer
extends Trainer
    The plain back-propagation trainer with optional momentum term.
    Version:
    $Id: BackpropTrainer.java 2294 2016-04-18 11:38:16Z helmut $
    Author:
    August Mayer, Helmut A. Mayer

    • Method Detail

      • reset

        protected void reset()
        Resets all neurons and links of the net for a fresh training procedure.
        Specified by:
        reset in class Trainer

      • train

        protected void train(java.util.List<java.lang.Double> input,
                     java.util.List<java.lang.Double> target)
        Performs training of a single pattern with the following steps:

        • apply input to net
        • calculate the error signal using a TrainingSignalGenerator
        • run through neurons according to tick list
        • train each neuron and its preceding links
        • reset the error signals of all neurons

        Specified by:
        train in class Trainer
        Parameters:
        input - an input pattern
        target - a target pattern

      • endPattern

        protected void endPattern()
        Resets the error signals of all neurons.

      • endEpoch

        protected void endEpoch()
        Does nothing.
        Specified by:
        endEpoch in class Trainer

      • endTrain

        protected void endTrain()
        Does nothing.
        Specified by:
        endTrain in class Trainer

      • train

        protected void train(Neuron neuron)
        Adapts the bias value of the given neuron according to backprop learning.
        Parameters:
        neuron - the neuron to be trained

      • train

        protected void train(Link link)
        Adapts the weight of the given link according to BP learning. Also, the error signal is propagated to the source neuron, where the signal is added to the current error signal.
        Parameters:
        link - the link to be trained
